p: At RMS, we believe we are at a moment in time when the market and world dynamics around risk have changed massively, demanding new approaches. And with technology consistently evolving and innovating, we can enable compelling new risk solutions to meet emerging risks, opportunities, and challenges. It's a time of disruption and transformation.
p.1: Our vision is to create a more resilient and sustainable global society through a better understanding of risk. With every breakthrough and new idea, we get closer to making this a worldwide reality. From AI and machine learning to leading edge modeling and software development, we are focused on transforming catastrophe risk and building global opportunities.
p.2: In a culture built on trust and empowerment, every RMS employee is challenged to bring bold thinking and new ideas to the table. The work we do is advancing the risk management industry and helping to make the world more resilient. The challenge is immense and meaningful, which is why the best and brightest choose RMS.
p.6: The Risk Analytics team sits within RMS=E2=80=99 broader Model Success organization which itself works for both internal and external clients, helping them to better understand, interpret and accept the output and workings of RMS models. Within Model Success, Risk Analytics focuses on enabling client confidence, acceptance and understanding of major models and/or major model updates via execution of a robust product acceptance testing (PAT) cycle. The team provides in-depth analysis of new and updated models, working closely with the Model Development and Model Product Management teams. We are a team of intellectually curious and results driven individuals whose projects require that we possess:

li: Data analysis skills necessary to extract, organize, and visualize results from large datasets
li.1: Catastrophe modeling and physical science knowledge needed to interpret results and understand what drives them
li.2: Communication skills to explain key findings to audiences from a variety of backgrounds

p.7: Our team has a presence on both the East and West coast of the U.S. as well as London, and this role will be based in the RMS office in Newark, CA. If you enjoy a challenge and are looking to develop yourself across a broad set of skills in an exciting and interesting business, then this role is for you.

li: Someone who enjoys using their superior critical thinking, time management and planning skills as well as a keen attention to detail to take on new challenges and develop solutions for a variety of interesting projects
li.1: Someone who can effectively work independently but can also work collaboratively as a part of a multi-disciplinary team
li.2: Someone with strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation abilities who can communicate complex topics to audiences of varying technical backgrounds and business functions
li.3: Someone who wants to apply their technical background in physical science and/or coding to a variety of practical business applications
li.4: Someone who can comfortably and confidently handle occasional periods of highly time sensitive and business critical work

li: Working with and learning from senior colleagues, develop broad knowledge of RMS catastrophe models; grasp the fundamental science and methodological philosophies underpinning the models and learn to apply this knowledge to interpreting model output and behavior. Eventually look to use these skills to lead projects on your own.
li.1: Learn about RMS software and the database infrastructure that RMS models use to output data. Using this knowledge and with the guidance of senior colleagues, develop analytics and visualizations to investigate model output.
li.2: Present to internal and external parties such as RMS Model Development and Product Management team members to summarize and contextualize key findings from analytics that you create. Additionally, be able to provide a non-technical summary explaining the results and/or the algorithm used to create said results.
li.3: Work with colleagues across the wider Model Success team to learn about RMS=E2=80=99 customers and how/why they use RMS models.

p.14: Risk Management Solutions, Inc. (RMS) models and solutions help insurers, financial markets, corporations, and public agencies evaluate and manage global risk throughout the world. RMS has some 1,300 employees across 13 offices in the US, London, Bermuda, Zurich, India, China, Japan, Singapore, and Australia, with products and models covering six continents.
p.15: We lead an industry that we helped to pioneer=E2=80=94catastrophe risk modeling =E2=80=93 and continue to innovate. In May 2019, we announced the launch of RMS Risk Intelligence=E2=84=A2 (RI), an open, flexible and future-proof platform for strategic risk management. Through this purpose-built platform, clients can tap into RMS HD models, rich data layers, intuitive applications and APIs that simply integrate into existing enterprise systems to support business decisions across underwriting, risk selection, mitigation and portfolio management.
p.16: Insurers, reinsurers, trading companies, and other financial institutions trust RMS solutions to better understand and manage the risks of natural and human-made catastrophes, including hurricanes, earthquakes, floods, terrorism, and pandemics.
